      • getObjectReference

        public <T extends IActorObserver> T getObjectReference(Class<T> iClass,
                                                       T observer)
        Installs this observer into this node. Can called several times the object is registered only once.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of reference class returned.
        Parameters:
        iClass - hint to the framework about which IActorObserver interface this object represents. Can be null if there are no ambiguities.
        observer - the object to install
        Returns:
        a remote reference that can be sent to actors.

      • getObserverReference

        public <T extends IActorObserver> T getObserverReference(Class<T> iClass,
                                                         T observer,
                                                         String id)
        Installs this observer into this node with the given id. If called twice for the same observer, the ids must match. Usually it's recommended to let the framework choose the id;
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of reference class returned.
        Parameters:
        iClass - hint to the framework about which IActorObserver interface this object represents. Can be null if there are no ambiguities.
        observer - the object to install
        id - can be null, in this case the framework will choose an id.
        Returns:
        a remote reference that can be sent to actors.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if called twice with the same observer and different ids

      • registerTimer

        public Registration registerTimer(OrbitActor<?> actor,
                                  Callable<Task<?>> taskCallable,
                                  long dueTime,
                                  long period,
                                  TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Description copied from interface: IRuntime
        Registers a timer to for the orbit actor
        Specified by:
        registerTimer in interface IRuntime
        Parameters:
        actor - the actor requesting the timer.
        taskCallable - a callable that must return a task.
        dueTime - the first time the timer will tick.
        period - the period of subsequent ticks (if ZERO then will only tick once)
        timeUnit - the time unit for period and dueTime
        Returns:
        a registration that allows to cancel the timer.

      • clock

        public Clock clock()
        Description copied from interface: IRuntime
        Gets the local clock. It's usually the system clock, but it can be changed for testing.
        Specified by:
        clock in interface IRuntime
        Returns:
        the clock that should be used for checking the time during tests.

      • registerReminder

        public Task<?> registerReminder(IRemindable actor,
                                String reminderName,
                                long dueTime,
                                long period,
                                TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Description copied from interface: IRuntime
        Registers or updated a persisted reminder.
        Specified by:
        registerReminder in interface IRuntime
        Parameters:
        actor - the reference to the actor.
        reminderName - the remainder's name
        dueTime - how long since now the first tick should be triggered.
        period - after the first tick, how often should the reminder be called.
        timeUnit - the time unit for dueTime and period
        Returns:
        completion promise for this operation

        Parameters:
        actor - the actor that registered this reminder
        reminderName - the remainder's name
        Returns:
        completion promise for this operation

      • getRemoteObserverReference

        public <T extends IActorObserver> T getRemoteObserverReference(INodeAddress address,
                                                               Class<T> iClass,
                                                               Object id)
        Returns an observer reference to an observer in another node.

        Should only be used if the application knows for sure that an observer with the given id indeed exists on that other node.

        This is a low level use of orbit-actors, recommended only for IOrbitProviders.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the IActorObserver sub interface
        Parameters:
        address - the other node address.
        iClass - the IObserverClass
        id - the id, must not be null
        Returns:
        a remote reference to the observer

      • sendMessage

        public Task<?> sendMessage(IAddressable toReference,
                           boolean oneWay,
                           int methodId,
                           Object[] params)
        Description copied from interface: IRuntime
        Sends a message to an actor or observer.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface IRuntime
        Parameters:
        toReference - destination actor reference or observer reference
        oneWay - should expect an answer, if false the task is completed with null.
        methodId - the generated id for the method
        params - the method parameters, must all be serializable.
        Returns:
        a future with the return value, or a future with null (if one-way)

        Parameters:

        oneWay - should expect an answer, if false the task is completed with null.
        methodId - the generated id for the method
        params - the method parameters, must all be serializable.
        Returns:

      • locateActor

        public Task<INodeAddress> locateActor(IAddressable actorReference,
                                      boolean forceActivation)
        Description copied from interface: IRuntime
        Locates the node address of an actor.
        Specified by:
        locateActor in interface IRuntime
        forceActivation - a node will be chosen to activate the actor if it's not currently active. Actual activation is postponed until the actor receives one message.
        Returns:
        actor address, null if actor is not active and forceActivation==false
